Mantis egg cases (called an ootheca singularly) can be purchased in garden supply centers as a means of biological control of pest insects. egg white is the common name for the clear liquid (also called albumen or ovalbumin or glair) contained within an egg. It is the cytoplasm of the egg, which until fertilization is a single cell. It consists mainly of about 10% proteins dissolved in water. Since it derives from birds, it will be considered as a NHP, under schedule 1, item 1, Priority 3 (non-human animal material material).";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:96:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (non-human animal material) of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:158:"Consideré comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1, matière animale autre qu'une matière provenant de l'humain, du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"83016";s:18:"field_parent_space";s:22:"MI Organism Substances";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:7:"Albumen";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"ABS";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:6:"NHANML";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";}i:198266;a:26:{s:5:"title";s:34:"Concha Meretricis seu Cyclinae_ABS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198266";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"94423";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:840:"Clams are shelled marine or freshwater mollusks, which are belonging to the class Bivalvia.  "Clam" is a term that can be referring to any bivalve, which is mollusk whose oval shape body is protected by symmetrical shells, that is not an oyster, mussel or scallop.  Clams can be hard-shelled or soft-shelled, depending on the calcification of their shells, varying between species.  Sea Clam Shell are used, usually as a chinese traditional medecine, to clear heat in the lungs and to resolve phlegm.  Two of the species used are Cyclina sinensis Gmelin and Meretrix meretrix L., but this natural medicine is also known under the pharmaceutical name Concha Meretricis Seu Cyclinae.  For these reasons, Clam shells will be considered as a NHP, under Schedule 1, item 3 (Priority 3; non-human animal material material) of the NHP Regulations.";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:96:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (non-human animal material) of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:158:"Consideré comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1, matière animale autre qu'une matière provenant de l'humain, du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"83017";s:18:"field_parent_space";s:22:"MI Organism Substances";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:30:"Concha Meretricis seu Cyclinae";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"ABS";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:6:"NHANML";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";}i:198267;a:27:{s:5:"title";s:9:"Honey_ABS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198267";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"94423";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:204:"Honey is a sweet and viscous fluid produced by bees and other insects from the nectar of flowers. It contains all of the B-complex vitamins, including a high concentration of pantothenic acid (vitamin B5) and vitamin B6 (pyridoxine), and is the only natural source of pure acetylcholine. Royal jelly also contains minerals, enzymes, hormones, eighteen amino acids, antibacterial and antibiotic components, and vitamins A, C, D and E. Three different kinds of Shea butter exists: crude unrefined, filtered and chemically refined, which are different in constituents due to the alterations made in each process, especially in the chemically refined version.  Shea butter is mostly used in cosmetic industry as a emollient and moisturizer, which is why it is currently listed in the NHPD acceptable NMIs list.  Medicinally, it is known to possess some anti-inflammatory properties.  Therefore, Shea butter will be considered as a NHP, under Schedule 1; item 2 (Priority 4; Extract) of the NHP Regulations.";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:94:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (plant or plant material) of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:127:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante ou matière végétale) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"83071";s:18:"field_parent_space";s:22:"MI Organism Substances";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:11:"Shea butter";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHS";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:5:"PLANT";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";}i:198278;a:26:{s:5:"title";s:26:"Tea tree essential oil_AHS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198278";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"94423";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:471:"Tea tree oil is a yellow- or green-tinged essential oil with a fresh camphoraceous odour.  It is extracted from the leaves of the tree Melaleuca alternifolia which is native to the northeast coast of New South Wales, Australia.  Tea tree oil is obtained by the distillation of the leaves of the tea tree. The oil contains more than 100 monoterpenoid, sesquiterpenoid, and alcohol compounds.  It will be considered as a NHP, under Schedule 1, item 2, Priority 4 (Extract).";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:78:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 2 (extract) of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:108:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 2 (un extrait) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"83072";s:18:"field_parent_space";s:22:"MI Organism Substances";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:22:"Tea tree essential oil";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHS";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:3:"EXT";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";}i:198279;a:26:{s:5:"title";s:26:"Stevia rebaudiana leaf_AHS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198279";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:17:"93625;92931;94423";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:191:"Stevia and its isolates may be beneficial in the maintenance of healthy blood sugar and blood pressure levels.Not recommended for pregnant women, children or those who have low blood pressure";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:78:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 2 (extract) of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:108:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 2 (un extrait) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:275:"The maximum daily limit for stevia as a medicinal ingredient without cautionary labelling and additional safety evidence is set at 4 mg/kg bw/day expressed as steviol content. Organism Substances";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:33:"Saw palmetto liposterolic extract";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHS";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:3:"EXT";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";}i:198389;a:26:{s:5:"title";s:19:"Galla Chinensis_AHS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198389";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:11:"95955;94423";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1480:"Chinese gall is the abnormal growth (gall) produced by parasitic aphids (insect) of Melaphis chinensis on the leaf or stems of Rhus chinensis (Chinese sumac), Rhus potaninii (potanin sumac) or Rhus punjabensis (red-punjab sumac), a deciduous dungarunga of the family Anacardiaceae. The gall aphid deposits a larva in leaves and stems of these trees and makes them produce the gall that looks like a hard and round excretions [1-2]. Galls (including Chinese gall) are rich in resins, tannic acid, and gallic acid [3-4]. Recent study shows the Chinese gall might exert anti-diabetic effect by suppressing carbohydrate absorption from intestine, and thereby reducing the postprandial increase of blood glucose [5]. Chinese gall will be considered as a NHP, under Schedule 1, item 1, Priority 4 (Plant material).

Like other types of gelatin, it consists of proteins (amino acids) [3-4]. Donkey hide gelatin will be considered as a NHP, under schedule 1, item 2, Priority 4 (Extract).

gall is highly valued in the traditional medicine of the scholars.  In traditional medicine, the snakes' gall combined with old tangerine skin make a very efficacious remedy against coughing. Snake's gall is also used for its anti burn properties, in the treatment of rheumatic pains, and amenorrhoea [1]. Chemical composition: Chenodeoxycholic acid, Cholic acid, Conjugated bile acid, Deoxycholic acid, Free bile acid, Glycocholic acid, Glycodeoxycholic acid, Glycohyodeoxycholic acid, Glycolithocholic acid, Glycoursodeoxycholic acid, Lithocholic acid, Lycine,Taurine, Taurochenodeoxycholic acid, Taurocholic acid, Taurodeoxycholic acid, Taurodeoxysodium cholate, Taurolithocholic acid, Tauropythonsodium cholate, Tauroursochenodeoxycholic acid, Ursodeoxycholic acid and trace elements Zn, Cu and Fe and macro-elements Ca and Mg [2]. Sanke's gall will be considered as a NHP, under schedule 1, item 1, Priority 3 (non-human animal material).

Organism Substances";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:17:"Rhizoma Drynariae";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHS";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:5:"PLANT";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";}i:198453;a:26:{s:5:"title";s:14:"Echium oil_AHS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198453";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"92798";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1228:"Helmi Hussien/HC-SC/GC/CA wrote on 2009-03-27 04:17:21 PM:
Echium oil is extracted from seeds of the Echium plantagineum plant. It contains Palmitic, Oleic, Stearic, Linoleic, α-Linolenic, γ-Linolenic, and Stearidonic acids (Frank Gunstone 2007). Echium oil increases plasma and neutrophil long-chain (n-3) fatty acids and lowers serum triacylglycerols in hypertriglyceridemic humans (Surette, Edens et al. 2004). Recent studies have shown that echium oil and other oils containing stearidonic acid as well as botanical oil combinations (such as echium and borage oils) hold great promise for modulating inflammatory diseases (Chilton, Rudel et al. 2008). Echium oil will be considered as a NHP, under Schedule 1, item 2, Priority 4 (Extract).

References: 
Chilton, F. H., L. L. Rudel, et al. (2008). "Mechanisms by which botanical lipids affect inflammatory disorders." Amer Soc Clinical Nutrition 87(2): 498S-503S. 
Frank Gunstone, J. H., Albert Dijkstra (2007). The Lipid Handbook, CRC Press. 
Surette, M. E., M. Edens, et al. (2004). "Dietary echium oil increases plasma and neutrophil long-chain (n-3) fatty acids and lowers serum triacylglycerols in hypertriglyceridemic humans." venom_ABS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198464";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"93339";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1038:"Here's an interesting classification of Bee Venom:
Bee venom (Apitoxin) (US-NLM 2009) is a complex mixture of vasoactive amines (dopamine, histamine, norepinephrine), enzymes (phospholipase A 2 , hyaluronidase, acid phosphatase, lysophospholipase, α-d-glucosidase), and toxic peptides (melittin, apamin, protease inhibitor, secapin, peptide 401) (Barceloux 2008). Bee venom showed to have anti-arthritis, anti-cancer, and pain release (anti-nociceptive) effect (Son, Lee et al. 2007). Bee venom will be considered as a NHP, under schedule 1, item 1, Priority 3 (Non-human animal material).
References:

Son, D. J., J. W. Lee, et al. (2007). "Therapeutic application of anti-arthritis, pain-releasing, and anti-cancer effects of bee venom and its constituent compounds." Pharmacology & Therapeutics 115(2): 246-270. 
US-NLM. (2009). oil is used as a source of polyunsaturated fatty acids, mainly EPA and DHA. (Lin 1995). The EPA and DHA in squid oil are distributed along the sn-2 position of the oil triglyceride (Ikeda 1998). Squid oil is very oxygen-sensitive and that has limited its use in food: however microencapsulation is commonly used to provide additional stabilisation to squid oil (Lin 1995).
Squid oil will be considered as an NHP, under item 2 (extract) of Schedule 1 of the NHP regulations.

Merci
Martin Charron";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:96:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (non-human animal material) of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:158:"Consideré comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1, matière animale autre qu'une matière provenant de l'humain, du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"83747";s:18:"field_parent_space";s:22:"MI Organism Substances";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:16:"Dried egg powder";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"ABS";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:6:"NHANML";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";}i:198469;a:26:{s:5:"title";s:27:"Kombucha, microbe based_ABS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198469";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:11:"94373;95441";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:2546:"Proper Name(s): Kombucha (NMCD 2010, Fundukian 2009)
Common Name(s): Kombucha (NMCD 2010, Fundukian 2009)

Kombucha is a beverage produced by fermenting sugared tea (e.g. sucrose and/or glucose in black and/or green tea) with a symbiosis of bacteria (e.g. Acetobacter xylinum, Acetobacter xylinoides, and/or Bacterium gluconicum) and yeast strains (e.g. Schizosaccharomyces pombe, Saccharomycodes ludwigii, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, and/or Fangus japonicus) (Fundukian 2009, Sreeramulu et al. 2000). The resulting broth is characterized by a floating cellulosic pellicle layer, where the cell mass of bacteria and yeasts is attached, on a sour liquid, containing acetic acid, ethanol, and gluconic acid as the major constituents, as well as substances like lactic acid, glucuronic acid, phenolic acid, B vitamins and enzymes as minor constituents (Chu and Chen 2006). Kombucha proved to exert antimicrobial activities against a wide range of bacteria, such as Escherichia coli, Shigella sonnei, Salmonella typhimurium, Salmonella enteritidis, and Campylobacter jejuni, even at neutral pH and after thermal denaturation (Sreeramulu et al. 2000). Apart from the organic acids, such as the ones mentioned above, the tea polyphenols (e.g. ()-epicatechin, ()-epicatechin gallate, ()-epigallocatechin, ()-epigallocatechin gallate, thearubigen, and theaflavin] are also believed to be active constituents present in kombucha tea, possessing a number of beneficial effects (Jayabalan et al. 2007).

Based on the above, Kombucha meets the substance aspect of the Natural Health Product (NHP) definition, under Schedule 1, item 2 (extract) of the NHP Regulations (Government of Canada 2010).

References:

Chu S.C., Chen C. 2006. Effects of origins and fermentation time on the antioxidant activities of kombucha. Food Chemistry 98: 502–507.

Fundukian L.J. 2009. The Gale Encyclopedia of Alternative Medicines. Third Edition. Gale, Cengage Learning.

Government of Canada 2010. Natural Health Products Regulations. URL: http://laws.justice.gc.ca/en/showtdm/cr/SOR-2003-196//?showtoc=&instrumentnumber=SOR-2003-196 [Accessed 2010-03-19].

Jayabalan R., Marimuthu S., Swaminathan K. 2007. Changes in content of organic acids and tea polyphenols during kombucha tea fermentation. Food Chemistry 102: 392–398.

NMCD 2010. Natural Medicines Comprehensive Database. Electronic version [Accessed 2010-03-19].

Sreeramulu G., Zhu Y., Knol W. 2002. Kombucha Fermentation and Its Antimicrobial Activity. Fossilia Ossia Mastodi
Primary Common Name: Dragon's Bones
Other Common Name(s): Dragon bone
Dragon's bone
Long Gu
Dragon's Bones is a traditional Chinese medicine. It is the calcified bones of pre-historic mammals unearthed. It will be considered as a NHP, under schedule 1, item 1, Priority 3 (non-human animal material).";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:74:"Considered NHP under Schedule 1 item 7, a mineral, of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:112:"Consideré comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 7, (un minéral), du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"83750";s:18:"field_parent_space";s:22:"MI Organism Substances";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:11:"Os Draconis";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"ABS";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:3:"MIN";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";}i:198471;a:26:{s:5:"title";s:29:"Chicken eggshell membrane_ABS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198471";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:11:"98718;95321";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:905:"Natural (chicken) eggshell membrane extract is primarily composed of fibrous proteins such as collagen type I and glycosaminoglycans including hyaluronic acid and chondroitin sulfate-dermatan sulfate copolymer. Removal of the inner eggshell membrane is achieved using a variety of methods such as treating the surface of eggshells by plasma etching. Also, different methods are used to determine the composition of the eggshell membrane extract. Based on the scientific evidence, chicken eggshell membrane will be considered as a NHP, under Schedule 1 item 2, extract. Reference: Ruff KJ, Winkler A, Jackson RW, DeVore DP, Ritz BW. 2009. Eggshell membrane in the treatment of pain and stiffness from osteoarthritis of the knee: a randomized, multicenter, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical study. Clin Rheumatol. 28(8):907–914. Available from: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2711914/";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:72:"Considered NHP under Schedule 1 item 2, extract, of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:108:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 2 (un extrait) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"83756";s:18:"field_parent_space";s:22:"MI Organism Substances";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:25:"Chicken eggshell membrane";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"ABS";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:6:"NHANML";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";}i:198472;a:26:{s:5:"title";s:31:"Kefir grains, microbe based_ABS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198472";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"95441";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:2081:"Kefir is an effervescent fermented dairy product made by inoculating cow, goat or sheep milk with kefir grains, irregular granules varying in size from 3 to 35 mm in diameter. It contains lactic acid bacteria (Lactobacillus, Lactococcus, Leuconostoc), sometimes acetic acid bacteria, lactose-fermenting yeasts (Kluyveromyces lactis, Kluyveromyces marxianus and Torula kefir), and non-lactose-fermenting yeasts (Sacchoromyces cerevisiae). These live microorganisms, along with casein and complex sugars, exist in a matrix of polysaccharides called kefiran. The yeasts are important in kefir fermentation, as they produce carbon dioxide and hence the characteristic effervescence [Magalhaes et al. 2010]. Experimental results in a mouse model have shown that some of the low molecular weight peptides produced during fermentation interact with the gut wall cells and stimulate the immune system, which may help protect against disease and infection. The polysaccharide kefiran, composed of repeating units of branched hexa- and heptasaccharides of mainly glucose and galactose [Guzel-Seydim et al. 2005], is also thought to assist the immune system [AAFC 2006]. Kefir will be considered a NHP under Schedule 1, item 1, non-human animal material, of the Natural Health Products Regulations.
References
AAFC 2006. Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada Newsroom Agribites. Kefir: the Champagne of Milk Products. Available from: http://www.agr.gc.ca/cb/index_e.php?s1=tip-puce&s2=2006&page=04
Guzel-Seydim Z, Twyffels J, Seydim AC, Greene A. 2005. Turkish kefir and kefir grains: microbial enumeration and electron microscobic observation. International Journal of Dairy Technology 58(1):25-29. Available from: http://www3.interscience.wiley.com/cgi-bin/fulltext/118668002/PDFSTART

Production of fermented cheese whey-based beverage using kefir grains as starter culture: Evaluation of morphological and microbial variations. hip_AHS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198475";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:11:"95725;94423";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1707:"Rose hips have traditionally been used as folk medicine and as a nutritional food source in many countries and cultures around the globe, including the indigenous peoples of the Americas[Natural Standards 2010]. The use of a rose hip powder standardized to at least 500mg Vitamin C per 100g[Rein et al. 2008] has been the subject of clinical trials for reduction of the pain of osteoarthritis. A recent study has identified three triterpene acids, oleanolic acid or ursolic acid in combination with betulinic acid, which are likely to contribute to the immunomodulatory effect of the standardized rose hip powder in reducing the pain associated with osteoarthritis[Saaby et al. 2010]. Rose hip will be considered a NHP under Schedule 1, item 1, (plant) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.

as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (plant or plant material) of the NHP Regulations. Acorus species have been identified as substances with potential health risks. Therefore, as per the Natural Health Product Compliance Guide, unauthorized products for sale in Canada which contain this ingredient are subject to compliance action in conjunction with the Risk-Based Approach. While NHPD will accept product licence applications for products containing Acorus species, sufficient evidence for the safety, efficacy and quality of the product must be provided before an NPN will be granted. http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodnatur/legislation/docs/complian-conform_guide_e.html.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:828:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante ou matière végétale) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels. Espèces Acorusa été identifié comme substances avec des risques possibles pour la santé. Par conséquent, tel qu'indiqué dans le Guide de conformité des produits de santé naturels, des produits non homologués en vente au Canada qui contiennent cet ingrédient font l'object de mesures de conformité en conjonction avec l'approche fondée sur les risques. Même si la DPSN accepte des demandes de produits de santé naturels contenant espèces Acorus, des preuves à l'appui suffisante en terme d'innocuité, d'efficacité et de qualité du produit doivent être naturels.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:566:"The quantity or concentration of carvacrol in all applicable essential oils or extracts must be declared. 
Based on safety concerns, oregano oil intake of up to 0.27 micrograms/kg body weight per day is allowed. Applicants must provide evidence to support the safe use of the carvacrol content of oil of oregano, if they would like to use a higher quantity as a NMI in their product. If the daily exposure of carvacrol exceeds 0.23 micrograms/kg bw per day from the NHP in the absence of adequate safety evidence, the oil of oregano cannot be considered to be a NMI.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:751:"La quantité ou concentration de carvacrol dans toutes les huiles ou extraits essentiels applicables doit être déclarée. 11À cause de préoccupations reliées à l'innocuité, un apport d'huile d'origan allant jusqu'à 0.27 microgrammes/kg de poids corporel par jour est permis. Les demandeurs doivent fournir des preuves appuyant l'innocuité de la quantité du carvacrol présente dans l'huile d'origan s'ils désirent en utiliser une quantité plus élevée comme ingrédient non médicinal dans leurs produits. Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"84141";s:18:"field_parent_space";s:22:"MI Organism Substances";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:17:"Herba Erigerontis";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHS";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:5:"PLANT";s:20:"field_route_of_admin";s:6:"TOPICL";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:2:"CP";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";}i:198738;a:27:{s:5:"title";s:24:"Kefir, microbe based_ABS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198738";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"95441";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:2081:"Kefir is an effervescent fermented dairy product made by inoculating cow, goat or sheep milk with kefir grains, irregular granules varying in size from 3 to 35 mm in diameter. It contains lactic acid bacteria (Lactobacillus, Lactococcus, Leuconostoc), sometimes acetic acid bacteria, lactose-fermenting yeasts (Kluyveromyces lactis, Kluyveromyces marxianus and Torula kefir), and non-lactose-fermenting yeasts (Sacchoromyces cerevisiae). These live microorganisms, along with casein and complex sugars, exist in a matrix of polysaccharides called kefiran. The yeasts are important in kefir fermentation, as they produce carbon dioxide and hence the characteristic effervescence [Magalhaes et al. 2010]. Experimental results in a mouse model have shown that some of the low molecular weight peptides produced during fermentation interact with the gut wall cells and stimulate the immune system, which may help protect against disease and infection. The polysaccharide kefiran, composed of repeating units of branched hexa- and heptasaccharides of mainly glucose and galactose [Guzel-Seydim et al. 2005], is also thought to assist the immune system [AAFC 2006]. Kefir will be considered a NHP under Schedule 1, item 1, non-human animal material, of the Natural Health Products Regulations. References AAFC 2006. Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada Newsroom Agribites. Kefir: the Champagne of Milk Products. Available from: http://www.agr.gc.ca/cb/index_e.php?s1=tip-puce&s2=2006&page=04 Guzel-Seydim Z, Twyffels J, Seydim AC, Greene A. 2005. Turkish kefir and kefir grains: microbial enumeration and electron microscobic observation. International Journal of Dairy Technology 58(1):25-29. Available from: http://www3.interscience.wiley.com/cgi-bin/fulltext/118668002/PDFSTART Magalhães KT, Pereira MA, Nicolau A, Dragone G, Domingues L, Teixeira JA, de Almeida Silva JB, Schwan RF. 2010. Production of fermented cheese whey-based beverage using kefir grains as starter culture: Evaluation of morphological and microbial variations. antler is a chinese natural medecine that can be used to replendish blood and essence, to tonify kidney and to strenthten the bones and tendons.  It is essentially boiled and dried deer antlers that are cut into slices, and have sweet, salty and warm taste.  It is known under the pharmaceutical name Cornu Cervi Pantotrichum.  The antlers essentially comes from two deer species, Cervus nippon Temminck and Cervus elaphus L. The FDA regulates such products as drugs when there are therapeutic claims.  If a sponsor wished to market a product containing colostrum with a therapeutic claim, the product would be classified as a drug (biologic or NHP). Currently products containing colostrum cannot be classified as biologics because it (colostrum) is not listed in Schedule D. Furthermore, those products that claim to support the immune system are not considered to be biologics as they do not meet the definition of “immunizing agents” as listed on Schedule D.  Claims proven to meet the definition of “immunizing agents” would fall under Schedule D and any unproven claims would be in violation of the Act and Regulations.

Immunoglobulins are non-NHPs because they are listed in Schedule D of the Food and Drugs Act as follows: Immunizing agents. As such, total immunoglobulins are excluded from the definition of a Natural Health Product (NHP). Natural health products like Bovine colostrum and Goat milk colostrum, for example, cannot be standardised to either total or specific immunoglobulins.";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:96:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (non-human animal material) of the NHP as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (plant or plant material) of the NHP Regulations. Acorus species have been identified as substances with potential health risks. Therefore, as per the Natural Health Product Compliance Guide, unauthorized products for sale in Canada which contain this ingredient are subject to compliance action in conjunction with the Risk-Based Approach. While NHPD will accept product licence applications for products containing Acorus species, sufficient evidence for the safety, efficacy and quality of the product must be provided before an NPN will be granted. http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodnatur/legislation/docs/complian-conform_guide_e.html.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:828:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante ou matière végétale) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels. Espèces Acorusa été identifié comme substances avec des risques possibles pour la santé. Par conséquent, tel qu'indiqué dans le Guide de conformité des produits de santé naturels, des produits non homologués en vente au Canada qui contiennent cet ingrédient font l'object de mesures de conformité en conjonction avec l'approche fondée sur les risques. Même si la DPSN accepte des demandes de produits de santé naturels contenant espèces Acorus, des preuves à l'appui suffisante en terme d'innocuité, d'efficacité et de qualité du produit doivent être fournies avant qu'un NPN soit accordé. http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodnatur/legislation/docs/complian-conform_guide_f.html";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:246:"For all Acorus species, there are concerns related to the content of beta-asarone. Acorus species have been identified as substances with potential health risks. Therefore, as per the Natural Health Product Compliance Guide, unauthorized products for sale in Canada which contain this ingredient are subject to compliance action in conjunction with the Risk-Based Approach. While NHPD will accept product licence applications for products containing Acorus species, sufficient evidence for the safety, efficacy and quality of the product must be provided before an NPN will be granted. http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodnatur/legislation/docs/complian-conform_guide_e.html.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:828:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante ou matière végétale) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels. Espèces Acorusa été identifié comme substances avec des risques possibles pour la santé. Par conséquent, tel qu'indiqué dans le Guide de conformité des produits de santé naturels, des produits non homologués en vente au Canada qui contiennent cet ingrédient font l'object de mesures de conformité en conjonction avec l'approche fondée sur les risques. Même si la DPSN accepte des demandes de produits de santé naturels contenant espèces Acorus, des preuves à l'appui suffisante en terme d'innocuité, d'efficacité et de qualité du produit doivent être fournies avant qu'un NPN soit accordé. http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodnatur/legislation/docs/complian-conform_guide_f.html";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:246:"For all Acorus species, there are concerns related to the content of beta-asarone. Toxic limits for beta-asarone: No more than (NMT) 10 mg/kg beta-asarone in dried rhizome of Acorus species or NMT 115 mcg/day of beta-asarone in finished products.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:283:"Pour toutes les espèces d'Acorus, il y a des inquiétudes en terme de contenu en Bêta-asarone. Saigae Tataricae_ABS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"199384";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-07-23";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:17:"93509;94423;93509";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1075:"Antelope horn: Saiga tatarica is an antelope from genus Saiga which is concentrated in three main areas within central Asia: Mongolia, Kazakhstan, and Kalmykia (Michigan 2009). The horns have some value as traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) and for that reason Saiga are now endangered by poaching. Based on the TCM, antelope horn extinguishes wind, calms Liver, drains heat, reduces toxin, and brightens eyes (Liu, Tseng et al. 2005). An extract of antelope horn showed mild caspase-inhibitory activity (activation of caspases is a critical step in neuronal apoptosis/programmed cell death) (Fattorusso, Frutos et al. 2006). Antelope horn will be considered as a NHP, under schedule 1, item 1, Priority 3 (Non-human animal material).

References:
Fattorusso, R., S. Frutos, et al. (2006). "Traditional Chinese medicines with caspase-inhibitory activity." Phytomedicine 13(1-2): 16-22.
Liu, C., A. Tseng, et al. (2005). Chinese Herbal Medicine- Modern Applications of Traditional Formulas, CRC Press.
Michigan, U. (2009). naturels.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:565:"The quantity or concentration of carvacrol in all applicable essential oils or extracts must be declared. Based on safety concerns, oregano oil intake of up to 0.27 micrograms/kg body weight per day is allowed. Applicants must provide evidence to support the safe use of the carvacrol content of oil of oregano, if they would like to use a higher quantity as a NMI in their product. If the daily exposure of carvacrol exceeds 0.23 micrograms/kg bw per day from the NHP in the absence of adequate safety evidence, the oil of oregano cannot be considered to be a NMI.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:749:"La quantité ou concentration de carvacrol dans toutes les huiles ou extraits essentiels applicables doit être déclarée. À cause de préoccupations reliées à l'innocuité, un apport d'huile d'origan allant jusqu'à 0.27 microgrammes/kg de poids corporel par jour est permis. Les demandeurs doivent fournir des preuves appuyant l'innocuité de la quantité du carvacrol présente dans l'huile d'origan s'ils désirent en utiliser une quantité plus élevée comme ingrédient non médicinal dans leurs produits. En l'absence de donnés appuyant l'innocuité, l'huile d'origan ne peut pas être considérée comme ingrédient non médicinal si l'exposition du carvacrol provenant du PSN dépasse 0.23 microgrammes /kg de Oil_ABS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"199466";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:18:"94922;99464;114818";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1083:"Schizochytrium is a genus of microalgae (Class: Phycomycota, algae-like fungi) from the family Thraustochytriaceae (ITIS 2010, GBIF 2010). Schizochytrium  and its oil are rich sources of omega-3 fatty acids, notably DHA (Doughman et al. 2007).
Based on the above, Schizochytrium and its oil meet the substance aspect of the Natural Health Product (NHP) definition, under Schedule 1, item 1 (alga) or 2 (extract), of the NHP Regulations (Government of Canada 2010).
References:
Doughman S.D., Krupanidhi S., Sanjeevi C.B. 2007. Omega-3 Fatty Acids for Nutrition and Medicine: Considering Microalgae Oil as a Vegetarian Source of EPA and DHA. Current Diabetes Reviews 3: 198-203.
GBIF 2010. Global Biodiversity Information Facility. URL: http://data.gbif.org/welcome.htm [Accessed 2010-05-14]
Government of Canada 2010. Natural Health Products Regulations. URL: http://laws.justice.gc.ca/en/showtdm/cr/SOR-2003-196//?showtoc=&instrumentnumber=SOR-2003-196 [Accessed 2010-05-14].
ITIS 2010. Integrated Taxonomic Information System. yeast rice_ABS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"199527";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2015-02-10";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:25:"93422;94423;104663;104663";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:990:"Here's the revised response that is already revised and approved by Robin:

Red yeast rice refers to the product of fermentation of rice with various strains of the yeast Monascus purpureus. Red yeast rice has been used for centuries in China in foods and in medicines. It was introduced in the U.S. during the latter half of the 1990s as a dietary supplement for the promotion of healthy serum lipid levels. Since red yeast rice contains the HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor lovastatin that is listed on the Schedule F to the Food and Drug Regulations without qualifiers, Health Canada has proposed an amendment to Schedule F to set a limit for lovastatin below which it would be acceptable in an NHP. Until such time as lovastatin's Schedule F listing is amended with qualifiers and published in Canada Gazette II and thus becomes official, Red yeast rice must be lovastatin-free to meet the definition of an NHP as per Schedule 1, item 1 (Priority 4; plant material) of the NHP Regulations.";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:449:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (plant or plant material) of the NHP Regulations. The Prescription Drug List exemption for Lovastatin, when sold for human use in oral dosage form that provides 1 milligram (mg) or less per daily dose, allows red yeast rice products containing only trace amounts of Lovastatin to be marketed as natural health products in Canada. http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodpharma/pdl-ord/pdl_list_fin_ord-eng.php";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:670:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante ou matière végétale) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels.  La levure de riz rouge doit être sans lovastatine pour remplir la définition d'un PSN tel qu'indiqué ci-haut. L’exemption de Lovastatin de la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance, quand vendu pour usage humain sous forme posologique orale à une concentration de 1.0 mg ou moins par dose quotidienne, permet la vente des produits contenant la levure de riz rouge qui contiennent que des quantités infimes de Lovastatin comme produits de santé naturels en Canada. http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodpharma/pdl-ord/pdl_list_fin_ord-fra.php";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"83739";s:18:"field_parent_space";s:22:"MI Organism Substances";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:14:"Red yeast rice";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"ABS";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:5:"PLANT";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:3:"PDL";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";}i:199529;a:26:{s:5:"title";s:20:"Rhizoma Typhonii_AHS";s:3:"nid";s:6:"199529";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2015-02-11";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:12:"94423;115654";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:0:"";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:94:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (plant or plant material) of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:127:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante ou matière végétale) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:174:"Typhonium giganteum roots are frequently adulterated with Aconitum species which contain C19-Diterpenoid alkaloids.
